title: Cell Theory and Microscopic Life

vocab.definition: The scientific theory that all living things are made of cells
An organism made of only one cell
An organism made of many cells
A specialized structure within a cell that performs specific functions
An instrument used to see objects too small for the naked eye

teachingNotes: Review the three parts of cell theory. Compare unicellular and multicellular organisms. Discuss how microscopes help us study cells.

sample.question: What scientific theory states that all living things are made of cells?

truefalse.question: All living things are made of at least one cell.

fillintheblank.question: An organism made of many cells is called ________.

shortanswer.question: What are the three main parts of cell theory?
expectedAny: all living things are cells, cells are basic unit, cells come from cells
made of cells, basic unit of life, come from existing cells
